techmeme.title: Overhaul, which uses AI to anticipate freight shipping delays to fight cargo theft for customers like Microsoft, raised $55M, bringing total funding to ~$150M (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
SCOTUS signals it is likely to uphold the TikTok divest-or-ban law, as a majority of justices suggested they see national security overriding free speech issues (Greg Stohr/Bloomberg)
Memo: Meta terminates major DEI programs, including for hiring, training, and procurement, citing a changed "legal and policy landscape" around DEI in the US (Axios)
The US DOJ indicts three Russian citizens for allegedly operating Bender.io and Sinbad.io crypto mixing services used by North Korea and ransomware gangs (Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai/TechCrunch)
El Capitan, the world's most powerful supercomputer, built by HPE and AMD as part of a $600M US DOE contract, is officially dedicated to handle classified tasks (Axios)
